author: Unknown
text:
Very interesting short blog article about how special assessment districts should be created to fund public transit infrastructure improvements. 
Here is the article:  http://marketurbanism.com/2010/09/13/internalizing-positive-transit-externalities/
Lots of good points.  In Alexandria, VA, direct access to Metro service can mean $40,000 in higher value for a 3 bedroom, 3 bath townhouse vs. one not within walking distance of a Metro.  
What do you think?  Unfair for those that do not utilize public transit services?
title: Special Assessment Districts to Fund Public Transit
